alert.note: Alert for Coastal Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 6:56PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHATHAM COUNTY... At 655 PM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Wassaw Island, or near Wilmington Island, moving northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Tybee Island, Wilmington Island, Midtown Savannah, Skidaway Island, Sandfly, Isle Of Hope, Wassaw Island and Whitemarsh Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch is in effect. Thunderstorms can produce tornadoes suddenly, sometimes with little or no warning. Be alert for rapidly changing weather conditions and be ready to act quickly if severe weather is observed or a warning is issued. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
